Title: IP Automation Systems Engineer (Cloud/Edge) - Denver, CO
Job_Description:
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role
This Lead Network Engineer position requires extensive experience in engineering, software development, systems administration, testing, and managing distinct lab environments: Development, QA-Test, and Preproduction of Edge Compute platforms. The candidate will also perform software engineering, development, and automation of Virtualization OpenStack, and Kubernetes environments. This includes managing all aspects of engineering, automation, Continuous Delivery Pipeline (CE/CI/CD), which includes monitoring, resolution, administration, and engineering of multiple private Edge Compute bare metal and virtualization environments. This role includes designing high-performing, scalable software, geographically redundant, and system solutions that must handle a high volume of transactions, throughput, and sessions. The ideal Lead Network Engineer will be a great motivator who can thrive in a Lean-Agile environment, with a consistent drive to find ways to improve the process, technology, and fellow employees.

Title: IP Automation Systems Engineer (Cloud/Edge) - Denver, CO
Job_Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary:
The Data & Intelligent Systems (D&IS) group within Allstate is a world-class technology organization focused on enabling Allstate to become a leader in the technology and data space. Allstate’s strategy continues to emphasize data and technology as we continue our digital transformation journey. This has created numerous opportunities in the Data & Intelligent Systems technology organization to find work that is meaningful to you. We are looking for a highly-skilled professional to join a highly visible project within Allstate.
The Content Management & Search (CMS) team within D&IS is responsible for supporting multiple platforms: web content management, digitial asset management, and search. CMS team members partner with a diverse group of clients – ranging from teams that support Allstate.com to teams that support customer data across all channels.
The Enterprise Search Engineer plays a critical role in the Apache Solr product lifecycle including: design, solutioning, execution, and taking ownership of operational excellence. Large scale, Enterprise data platforms rely on the Search team to ensure hundreds of millions of documents, terrabytes of data are effectively queried at sub-millisecond transaction rates. Your expertise in building and maintaining query and index pipelines, customizing feature capabilities, and ensuring the Apache Solr infrastructure is optimized to ensure a high-availability environment will be a welcome addition to diverse, global team of technologists.


The Enterprise Search Engineer core responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Implementation and support of large scale, Enterprise Apache Solr solutions.
Document detailed design, functional and technical specifications in developing Apache Solr solutions.
Exhibit expertise in Apache Solr architecture and the demonstrated competency to design, deploy and support solutions in a shared services architecture.
Develop, execute, and document procedures and standards adhering to SDLC best practices including the Agile Scrum methodology.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Troubleshoot technical issues, perform root cause analysis and take appropriate action to remediate issues.
Participates in the discovery phase of projects to determine high-level design.
Analyzes business needs and develops plans to implement software requirements in conjunction with product management and architects.
Independently handles high-impact, critical software/systems monitoring issues and tickets/ incidents.
Troubleshoots business and production issues.
Mentors and coaches junior developers in Apache Solr solutions.
Collaborates with other technologists as a member of a broad, cross-functional team motivated to solve business problems. Essential Criteria:
Candidates should clearly state on their application form how they meet each of the essential criteria as these will be assessed during shortlisting and only these deemed to meet all of the below criteria will move forward to the next stage.
3+ years experience with open source search engines like Lucene, Apache Solr , or Elasticsearch.
Experience building scalable, high performing and robust Java and .NET applications.
Puppet , Perl, Python, Bash, or Unix Shell and willingness to learn new technologies.
Experience with Node JS, AngularJS, Bootstrap or other web-based frameworks.
Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (e.g., Jenkins , Artifactory Pro, SonarQube, Selenium, Jmeter, and so forth).


Apache Solr
Java
Puppet
GitHub or Jenkins
Hands on experience and accountability architecting, designing, implementing and delivering large scale distributed systems and/or applications for the cloud, including microservices architectures and 12-factor principles
Experience of Spark.
Expertise with some or all of JBoss / Tomcat, or other application servers.
Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g., GitHub). On-Call Requirments:
On-Call Production Support rotation for all Apache Solr search environments every four (4) weeks. Rotation assignments last for an entire week (Monday-Sunday). Notes:
The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.
Test Salary Hyperlink
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

Title: IP Automation Systems Engineer (Cloud/Edge) - Denver, CO
Job_Description:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.
Description

We are seeking a Lead Video Engineer who will help drive our system’s evolution. The candidate will be an integral part of the Paramount+ Video Engineering Team, working with other video tech engineers to build and release products for various platforms like Desktop, OTT, Mobile. We are responsible for supporting the video delivery and architecture of VOD and Live content streamed on over 15 platforms for CBS All Access! Our team is also responsible for the encoding and delivery of premium content to millions of users every day. The candidate will also be responsible for doing minimal video quality check, building, deploying and managing video encoding applications to cloud (AWS/GCP).
Your Day-to-Day

Work with UI engineers to build scalable platforms for supporting Video management and publishing systems.
Work with designers, product owners and stakeholders to define and validate visual requirements, user workflow and UI prototypes.
Engage with engineers to maintain, evolve and modernize our existing video encoding platforms.
Advocate the pattern of reusability by creating and publishing component libraries.
Actively influence future innovations by following the latest and most efficient UI technology trends.
Advocate culture of teamwork and partnership between UI engineers.
Encourage an engineering culture that promotes test-driven development and long term product quality.
Key Projects

Lead a team and work with developers for building our Live CMS platform for scheduling live events and 24/7 streams and build front-end tools for our video encoding platform.
Build out microservices for our cloud (AWS/GCP) video processing workflows.
Qualifications
What you bring to the team
You have –

BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
7+ years of experience as a Software Engineer with experience in enterprise software development.
Experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript and React.
Experience with container technology and management such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with Cloud/SaaS services such as Amazon AWS, Google Cloud.
Experience with technical writing and design documentation.
Experience in programming languages such as NodeJs, Go, PHP or Python.
You might also have –

Familiarity with video protocols such as RTP, RTMP, HLS, HDS, Smooth Streaming.
Familiarity with modern video codecs like H264, VP8, VP9, AV1
Master’s Degree in Computer Science or similar, related field

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

$105,000.00 - 155,000.00.

The hiring salary range for this position applies to New York City, California, Colorado, Washington state, and most other geographies. Starting pay for the successful applicant depends on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to geographic location, market demands, experience, training, and education. The benefits available for this position include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan, life insurance coverage, disability benefits, tuition assistance program and PTO or, if applicable, as otherwise dictated by the appropriate Collective Bargaining Agreement. This position is bonus eligible.

Director, Product Management - Strategic Solutions
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company. We believe that the future of infrastructure will be developer-led and software-defined, and we’re committed to helping digital leaders assemble infrastructure in minutes, anywhere in the world, on-demand from an ecosystem of providers.
To make this vision possible, we’re building a set of products and capabilities that deliver to the needs of practitioners, builders, and creators, and a culture that is constantly learning how to more efficiently and effectively accelerate the journey of each of our users. A key component of this strategy is building a dedicated product practice for our digital services business focused on Solution Offerings.
As leader of the Strategic Solutions product area, your goal will be to deeply understand the capabilities and advantages of the various products and solutions on our platform; engage with customers, prospects, partners, and industry experts to identify the most promising and high impact business outcomes; and to then work directly with product designers, engineers, marketing, GTM stakeholders, and most critically, our service provider and product partners (OEMs, software developers, technology partners, professional and managed service providers, etc.) to assemble compelling paths that allow customers to realize that value. This is a cross functional role that demands the ability to effectively work with and manage internal and external stakeholders while optimizing long term outcomes for customers, partners, and Equinix.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. As a Program Manager, you’ll be responsible for supporting Detections Platform whose mission is to support the CrowdStrike technology stack with security and detection-related services and components, ensuring the continuous evolution of our world-class Falcon product. Your primary focus will entail driving the scheduling, scoping and execution of projects for the teams, working directly with the Engineering Developers, the Product Managers, Dev Managers and Executive Leadership in order to ensure timely delivery against the roadmap. You’ll work closely across functional teams (UX, Cloud, Sensor) to collaborate and ensure dependencies are well known, critical issues are identified and driven to resolution.
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. For applicants in Ithaca - NY, New Jersey City - NJ, and Colorado, the salary range is $120,000 - $190,000 per year + bonus + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, and certifications. The salary range may differ in other states.

Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation. We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted, like the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show, are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

Title: IP Automation Systems Engineer (Cloud/Edge) - Denver, CO
Job_Description:
Job Description
As a leading market maker across many regions and asset classes, Citadel Securities operates a large and diverse technology platform. With a large number of contributors to our platform across software development, strategy development, quantitative research, trading operations and compliance, it is of paramount importance that only the highest quality code be deployed into production. Maintaining these strict levels of quality assurance while allowing for rapid development and deployment requires extensive use of automation.
Key components of our technology platform are developed by our Trading System Development teams. These teams are tasked with developing cutting edge, state of the art trading systems that consistently outperform across multiple business areas. Title: IP Automation Systems Engineer (Cloud/Edge) - Denver, CO
Job_Description:
Position
Product Manager, Manufacturing Software
Location
2+ days per week in Burlington, MA. Remainder can be remote.
About LightForce
LightForce is a technology company focused on transforming orthodontics. Our digital platform empowers orthodontists with fully customized, 3D-printed tooth-moving tools. In 2019, we launched our first product - the world's only, fully customized 3D printed bracket system and digital treatment software. We are proud to be one of the fastest growing companies in the industry. Learn more at: www.lf.co (http://www.lf.co).
Description
LightForce, the world's only provider of patient specific, 3D printed orthodontic braces is looking for a bright, motivated Product Manager. As a Product Manager at LightForce, you will drive our vision for growth and help us revolutionize the Orthodontic profession. Working directly with our customers, management team, developers and manufacturing, you will define, plan, execute and validate new product features and initiatives. You will be working on our manufacturing software.
As a rapidly growing company, doing all manufacturing in house, we are scaling rapidly on our manufacturing line and the software that controls it all. We are constantly working to develop new ways to automate manual steps, using custom robotics, AI, and other automation tools both physical and digital. In addition, as a medical device company, maintaining quality is paramount and reducing costs and turnaround times is always a focus. This is an excellent opportunity to get in while we are still fairly small with just one factory in Burlington, MA, but you will see incredible growth as we scale to multiple facilities with a global footprint.
LightForce Orthodontics hires committed, self-motivated associates and then gives them the freedom and flexibility to do great work. You will help to grow a fantastic tech company, to advance the orthodontic profession, and to provide positive health benefits to patients.

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions. Overview & Responsibilities

We at Paramount are hiring a DevOps Engineer for the End User Technology & Experience (EUT) Group within Technology! The EUT team focuses on delivering engaging and intuitive experiences to boost efficiency, transformation, and engagement at enterprise scale, while making sure adoption and change management provide continued improvement. Responsibilities

Coordinate multiple SAAS tools like Slack, Zoom, O365, AWS/Azure etc.
Propose, scope, design, and implement various infrastructure architectures.
Deploy and maintain CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments, follow industry standards, perform retrospectives, code, and standard reviews.
Handle vital applications on cloud-native microservices architecture
Performs all DevOps activities, including the implementation, maintenance, monitoring, and verification of product builds and packaging to provide quality production builds.
Provide day-to-day application-level support for production incidents and L3 support.
Build and test automation tools for infrastructure provisioning.
Work closely with developers to adjust builds and packaging to changing tech product requirements.
Collaborate with other Tech platforms and partners to engineer a coordinated, end-to-end support framework across technology layers.
Anticipate future needs and technology evolution, and propose/participate in implementation of new solutions. Basic Qualifications

Experience in Slack administration. This includes approving custom and third-party applications based on permissions required by the app, running multiple workspaces, leading Guest Connect and Guest account provisioning, etc.
Scripting proficiency, preferably in PowerShell, REACT, or NodeJS, with knowledge of common language libraries.
Expertise in provisioning AWS/Azure services using infrastructure as code tools like Cloud Formation and Terraform. For this, understanding on AWS/Azure is a pre-requisite.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps, or similar automated continuous integration software.
Strong understanding of micro-services and related architectures. Additional Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Solid grasp of containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Expertise in Git & Git LFS.
Fundamental knowledge of AWS/Azure foundational services, such as IAM, EC2, ELB, VPC/Networking, S3, SQS, SNS (or equivalent experience with another cloud provider).
Akamai CDN+WAF exposure.
Familiarity with monitoring and logs management tools such as NewRelic and SumoLogic.
.NET 3.5/4.5 and above
oAuth, ADFS 2.0/3.0, FIM, AD, Windows Authentication NTLM, Kerberos, and other authentication. IDPs and SSO (Okta, Duo, Azure AD, etc.).
Strong communication and documentation skills.
An ability to push for goals and achievements while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to detail.
Excellent judgment, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Full understanding of software development lifecycle.
Top-notch time management and organizational skills
Exposure to Moveworks, SonarQube, and/or Workplace by Facebook administration would be a bonus.

Title: Inventory Control Specialist
Job_Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary:
The Data & Intelligent Systems (D&IS) group within Allstate is a world-class technology organization focused on enabling Allstate to become a leader in the technology and data space. Allstate’s strategy continues to emphasize data and technology as we continue our digital transformation journey. This has created numerous opportunities in the Data & Intelligent Systems technology organization to find work that is meaningful to you. We are looking for a highly-skilled professional to join a highly visible project within Allstate.
The Content Management & Search (CMS) team within D&IS is responsible for supporting multiple platforms: web content management, digitial asset management, and search. CMS team members partner with a diverse group of clients – ranging from teams that support Allstate.com to teams that support customer data across all channels.
The Enterprise Search Engineer plays a critical role in the Apache Solr product lifecycle including: design, solutioning, execution, and taking ownership of operational excellence. Large scale, Enterprise data platforms rely on the Search team to ensure hundreds of millions of documents, terrabytes of data are effectively queried at sub-millisecond transaction rates. Your expertise in building and maintaining query and index pipelines, customizing feature capabilities, and ensuring the Apache Solr infrastructure is optimized to ensure a high-availability environment will be a welcome addition to diverse, global team of technologists.


The Enterprise Search Engineer core responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Implementation and support of large scale, Enterprise Apache Solr solutions.
Document detailed design, functional and technical specifications in developing Apache Solr solutions.
Exhibit expertise in Apache Solr architecture and the demonstrated competency to design, deploy and support solutions in a shared services architecture.
Develop, execute, and document procedures and standards adhering to SDLC best practices including the Agile Scrum methodology.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Troubleshoot technical issues, perform root cause analysis and take appropriate action to remediate issues.
Participates in the discovery phase of projects to determine high-level design.
Analyzes business needs and develops plans to implement software requirements in conjunction with product management and architects.
Independently handles high-impact, critical software/systems monitoring issues and tickets/ incidents.
Troubleshoots business and production issues.
Mentors and coaches junior developers in Apache Solr solutions.
Collaborates with other technologists as a member of a broad, cross-functional team motivated to solve business problems. Essential Criteria:
Candidates should clearly state on their application form how they meet each of the essential criteria as these will be assessed during shortlisting and only these deemed to meet all of the below criteria will move forward to the next stage.
3+ years experience with open source search engines like Lucene, Apache Solr , or Elasticsearch.
Experience building scalable, high performing and robust Java and .NET applications.
Puppet , Perl, Python, Bash, or Unix Shell and willingness to learn new technologies.
Experience with Node JS, AngularJS, Bootstrap or other web-based frameworks.
Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (e.g., Jenkins , Artifactory Pro, SonarQube, Selenium, Jmeter, and so forth).


Apache Solr
Java
Puppet
GitHub or Jenkins
Hands on experience and accountability architecting, designing, implementing and delivering large scale distributed systems and/or applications for the cloud, including microservices architectures and 12-factor principles
Experience of Spark.
Expertise with some or all of JBoss / Tomcat, or other application servers.
Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g., GitHub). On-Call Requirments:
On-Call Production Support rotation for all Apache Solr search environments every four (4) weeks. Rotation assignments last for an entire week (Monday-Sunday). Notes:
The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.

Title: UX Designer - Design System
Job_Description:
About Us
Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.
We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.
About the Role
Twitch's community of broadcasters and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality visual experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. Your ability to summarize design system needs into functional, beautiful solutions will be paramount for achieving success.

Title: UX Designer - Design System
Job_Description:
You Have: • 2+ years experience as a UX designer, product designer, or interaction designer • An aesthetic sense and the ability to design a flexible and cohesive solution across many points of input • Empathy for those you work with who will use the design system day in and day out
Job summary About Us: Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog. About the Position: Twitch's community of broadcasters and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality visual experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. Your ability to summarize design system needs into functional, beautiful solutions will be paramount for achieving success. The Core UI Design System team at Twitch empowers our Designers and Engineers alike with consistent, accessible and aesthetic building blocks that bring their products to life. As part of this team, you will bring your touch to every product on Twitch as the backbone of the UI on our platform. We're looking for a gifted designer to establish new design patterns while building upon existing ones. We offer a series of stimulating problems, an environment that's exciting, motivating, fun, and new. The Core UI team presents the unique opportunity to work directly with your users every day and respond to their needs in real time. If you are an advocate for designing for humans and create playful and caring software for your customers, you will flourish on this team. This position can be located in Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; and Salt Lake City, UT or Remote US You Will: • Collaborate with engineers and designers across the company • Take full ownership of your designs from start to finish, including collaboration with partner teams, mockups, integration into the design library, documentation and hand off to engineering • Participate in the planning and ideation process for new components and patterns • Design UI components by using feedback, data, and an understanding of accessibility guidelines

For this position, UX experience, visual design chops, and creative problem-solving capabilities are paramount.

You will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you will own the experience for a wide area of the Tinybeans product.

Title: UX Designer - Design System
Job_Description:
About BeyondTrust
BeyondTrust is the worldwide leader in intelligent identity and access security, empowering organizations to protect identities, stop threats, and deliver dynamic access to empower and secure a work-from-anywhere world. Our integrated products and platform offer the industry's most advanced privileged access management (PAM) solution, enabling organizations to quickly shrink their attack surface across traditional, cloud and hybrid environments.
Learn more at www.beyondtrust.com.
Job Summary
The Sr Director Product Management, Cloud Security is responsible for planning and driving BeyondTrust Cloud Security offerings through all phases of the product lifecycle. You will be chartered with crafting the vision and executing the strategy for the BeyondTrust Cloud Security Management solutions while also leading the Cloud Security product management team. You will work with various platforms that leverage cloud modern technologies including AWS, Azure, and other cloud-native technology. The right candidate will have demonstrated leadership experience, expertise in cloud security technology and least privilege technology for multi-cloud environments. Your goal will be to deliver solutions that help minimize the risks of cloud security breaches and operational disruptions for cloud-native solutions.

You will collaborate with the client and teams often comprised of designers, developers, BA, product owners, and delivery managers on the client side. You will design and test prototypes to deliver incremental experiments from a prioritized set of hypotheses. In this role, you will also have the opportunity to explore the boundaries of building robust and innovative digital platforms.

The Freelance Experience (UX) Designer will be responsible for Agile routines, leading workshops with clients, collaborating with designers, developers, and BAs, and delivering fast-paced UX thinking in unrefined prototypes (often XD, Figma, or Sketch).

In this role you will leverage tools to identify and resolve friction points, delivering developer ready experiences that are smooth and seamless. You will also assist in continuous optimization by helping generate hypotheses and drafting test plans to iterate upon solutions already in production.

This role is dedicated to enhancing and building the fast-growing BeyondTrust Cloud Security Management solutions. Title: Mobile App Developer
Job_Description:
Company Summary
Join a team that puts its People First! As a member of First American’s family of companies, Data & Analytics is a national provider of property-centric information, analytics, risk management and valuation solutions. First American maintains and curates the industry’s largest property and ownership dataset with over 7 billion document images. Our major platforms and products include: DataTree®, FraudGuard®, RegsData™, TaxSource™ and ACI®. The First American Data & Analytics division boasts more than 20 patents and remains at the forefront of innovation - leveraging technology and data to deliver best-in-class decisioning solutions. Fueled by our industry-leading data and using our technology and proprietary process, our solutions provide lenders, real estate and title companies with actionable insights - enabling them to make better, increasingly automated, decisions. With offices in all major metropolitan areas, including California and New York, DNA teams work collaboratively from across the country. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for seven consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.

Title: Mobile App Developer
Job_Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary
The Mobile Product Owner will develop and execute mobile initiatives and projects, primarily focused on the product lifecycle for Allstate branded mobile applications and other emerging mobile technologies, consistent with business strategies. The Mobile Product Owner serves as the business product team-member working on the day-to-day implementation and development of mobile applications. The Mobile Product Owner will be responsible for day-to-day application development, backlog creation, backlog prioritization, story writing and acceptance to deliver business value from mobile app features and improvements. The Mobile Product Owner will also serve as a team and company resource in the areas of mobile engagement, mobile app development and mobile marketing.
Key Responsibilities
Work with the Product Managers to create and manage a consumer-focused product mobile roadmap, making strategic adjustments as needed based on consumer needs, resource allocation, technology delivery and corporate priority.
Work along side application developers, architects, scrum masters, business analysts, user experience architects, user acceptance testers and quality assurance testers to deliver mobile app code that meets Allstate’s business objectives
Represent the mobile product team in day-to-day agile scrum team meetings including:
Daily Stand-Ups
Sprint Reviews
Sprint and Program Increments Planning sessions
Sprint Retrospectives
Backlog refinement & grooming sessions
Product demonstrations
Manage analytics and performance reporting.
Liaison with key members of the marketing organization on communication programs that raise awareness and drive usage of the mobile self-service channel.
Participates in the management of vendor relationships and ensures information flows between business teams and vendor for successful completion of projects.
Identifying emerging trends and staying abreast of in mobile related areas such as connected automobile technology and adoption.
Supports and executes more complex mobile marketing campaigns intended to drive customer engagement including app personalization & content marketing, in-app messaging campaigns, push messaging campaigns and engagement strategies to drive app usage, feature adoption & cross-sell from existing app users.
Manages deep linking capabilities and customer feedback tools.
Supports and executes app user acquisition campaigns by working closely with marketing analytics and Consumer Marketing on download campaigns, supporting internal marketing efforts and executing App Store Optimization & Search programs. Education and Experience
Bachelor's Degree, Master’s preferred
The successful candidate will have at least 3-5 years of relevant experience, ideally 1-2 years in a mobile environment
Functional Skills
Familiarity with and affinity for agile development, collaboration and test-and-learn environments
Passionate about delivering mobile solutions that exceed expectations.
Ability to effectively understand data, analyze results, draw insights and conclusions, and recommend appropriate actions in an atmosphere of fact-based decision-making;
Proven ability to work in collaborative, matrixed environment.
Proven expertise in marketing, with specific experience in digital marketing, including e-commerce;
Strong consumer disposition with ability to define and communicate consumer-centric business requirements to technical and non-technical audiences;
Excellent communication and story-telling skills, including the ability to effectively translate and communicate technical information in a meaningful way to non-technical audiences;
Demonstrate a collaborative approach to achieving business results;
Experience in telematics, automotive, or internet of things is desired, but not required
Experience in social networks and mobile applications is desired, but not required
Compensation offered for this role is $67,300 - $112,000 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Title: Mobile App Developer
Job_Description:
The Dyrt is the largest digital camping platform in the world. Every second, a new user visits The Dyrt to access our community-driven campground information.
If you love the outdoors and want to be part of a fast-growing consumer app, you're in the right place.
The Role
As a software engineer at The Dyrt, you will be tasked with building a robust, maintainable web experience for the 1M+ campers using our website every month. Who we are
Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.
Summary:
As a full-stack developer, the associate is responsible for front-end and back-end application development. This role is responsible for the design, architecture, coding and implementation of user interfaces/applications, API’s, database interfaces, logic controls, error handling for web, cloud, thick client and standalone applications. In addition, the full stack developer builds integrations between local and remote systems both with company and third-party systems. Developer will sometimes perform and/or work with other associates to gather business logic and requirements, QA their code, and pass on to DevOps for productionizing.

Title: Network Project Manager - II

Job Description:
Network Project Manager II

Description: Job Description

Brief:
Seeking Project Managers to support a global utilities client, developing their network and security needs with industry leading solutions, growing their business digitization capabilities and improving efficiencies.

Job Requirements:
Lead a portfolio of projects, involving different stakeholders following benchmark PM methodology. Discipline is required in change control; budget management, and on-time delivery performance. It is critical that PM is able to decide priorities, optimizing results across workload
Environment is pressurized to continually deliver excellence and strive for continuous improvement in process efficiencies, document quality, and solution delivery. Individual needs to enjoy a challenge and relish continuously being encouraged to improve
Strong communication skills are critical to develop close relationships with the customer to collaborate as partners, allowing full understanding on critical focus areas, driving customer satisfaction.
All solutions are directly activated onto a live network. Therefore it is critical that implementations are rolled out with careful due diligence and focus on quality of work at all times, preventing any potential network failure or re-work actions
Influencing and negotiating skills are required to navigate the many inter departmental relationships to ensure the PM has the right resources allocated and priority within our business processes and systems to meet the customer goals
Risk/Issue mitigation skills and experience within complex solutions is paramount, to ensure budgets and delivery expectations are held, even when delays within the project timeline occur
Previous experience within a Telco environment and an understanding of networks and cyber security solutions is preferred

Title: Network Project Manager - II

Director, Product Management - Strategic Solutions
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company. We believe that the future of infrastructure will be developer-led and software-defined, and we’re committed to helping digital leaders assemble infrastructure in minutes, anywhere in the world, on-demand from an ecosystem of providers.
To make this vision possible, we’re building a set of products and capabilities that deliver to the needs of practitioners, builders, and creators, and a culture that is constantly learning how to more efficiently and effectively accelerate the journey of each of our users. A key component of this strategy is building a dedicated product practice for our digital services business focused on Solution Offerings.
As leader of the Strategic Solutions product area, your goal will be to deeply understand the capabilities and advantages of the various products and solutions on our platform; engage with customers, prospects, partners, and industry experts to identify the most promising and high impact business outcomes; and to then work directly with product designers, engineers, marketing, GTM stakeholders, and most critically, our service provider and product partners (OEMs, software developers, technology partners, professional and managed service providers, etc.) to assemble compelling paths that allow customers to realize that value. This is a cross functional role that demands the ability to effectively work with and manage internal and external stakeholders while optimizing long term outcomes for customers, partners, and Equinix.

Title: Network Project Manager - II
Job_Description:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage. Description:

Role Details:
Are you a hardworking individual contributor looking to join an agile Program Management Office? We are seeking a highly motivated Sr. Program Manager that will contribute to the success of our Program Delivery team. This person will work closely with the Agile Release Train engineer and lead the success of Paramount+ Streaming Service on new platforms and global market expansions!
Paramount+’s team of Program Managers are responsible for successfully delivering our Global programs. Our ideal candidate will play a vital part in partnering with our RTEs and lead our complex cross-functional and global programs across several Global scrum teams for Paramount+. The role knows what it takes to run large and complex programs. It involves multiple partners and a diverse team of collaborators taking a project from inception to delivery to delight our customers! Your Day-to-Day:
You are the main point of contact for Program and Feature Delivery for an Agile Release Train focused on New Global Markets and/or New Platforms.
Coordinate & facilitate program-level agile ceremonies for a globally dispersed set of scrum teams with coworkers in the West Coast, East Coast, and European time zones.
Contribute and run the PI Planning logistics of the PI Planning event quarterly; including lead-up, planning event, and outcomes.
Serve as the “air traffic controller,” guiding projects and objectives to deliver against aggressive timelines, partnering with scrum masters, product owners, and engineering to ensure successful delivery against PI commitments and complex projects.
Communicate to ART RTE around teams’ velocity, program health, risks, capacity issues, and roadblocks via various artifacts of scrum and common-sense communication efforts.
Prepare and lead project plans, documentation, risk mitigation, cross-team initiatives, and large projects/programs and act as the liaison between cross-functional teams (design, engineering, editorial, sales, and marketing) to drive end-to-end development of products to market.
Be a technical thought-leader, constantly improving how we work, championing a positive culture for your team and the wider business unit, and working with other PMs within the PMO to help cultivate agile scrum and scaled agile and other efficiency methodologies throughout the organization. Required Qualifications:
5+ years of Scrum Master or Project/Program Manager experience, leading multiple Scrum teams and large, complex deliveries with a deep understanding of all things Agile (Scrum, Kanban, and other methodologies), including the ceremonies of backlog grooming, standups, sprint planning, sprint review, and retrospective.
High proficiency with Jira, Confluence, Project Plans, Gantt, etc.
Ability to communicate effectively to executive stakeholders and leadership.
Proficiency and a strong understanding of SDLC.
Experience working in Web and Mobile Applications development teams in technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, PHP, IOS, and ANDROID.
A proactive, efficient, and resourceful approach and ability to thrive in a creative and fast paced environment.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Creative thinking - Looking “outside of the box” to problem-solve.
Willing to accommodate occasional travel between Los Angeles, San Francisco, and New York offices.
Able to handle high-level partners within the organization and help to balance competing needs and requests. Desired Qualifications or (You might also have):
Experience in direct-to-consumer entertainment, media products, and/or projects within Mobile, Desktop, OTT, and Smart TV screens and their backend architectures.
Working with Global teams, so will need to align with East Coast, West Coast & Central European time zones.

#LI-remote

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

$150,000.00 - 150,000.00.

Title: Network Project Manager - II
Job_Description:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

Paramount is searching for a Partner Platform Operations Manager . The Partner Operations team works on growing distribution of our best-in-class Paramount content across multiple types of digital partnerships and business models, including (but not limited to) ad-supported streaming, subscription video on demand (with Paramount+), and digital OTT and FAST products. We are a diverse and agile team that works in an exciting and fast-paced environment, working cross-functionally across different departments and partnering with multiple technology/distribution partners to ensure that we bring our premium content to consumers, however and wherever they want to consume it. This will be a hybrid work setup. Ideally, you will reside within commuting distance of our Burbank, CA or New York City, NY office/s for occasional onsite work.

The Partner Platform Operations Manager will play a key role as a foundational member of our growing partner operations function. In this role, the Operations Manager will be closely involved in tracking and owning the onboarding pipeline, process documentation management, content operations & partner integration support. They will work under the mentorship of the Senior Director, Partner Operations and partner with other key associates to address priority needs, while working on projects aimed to streamline operations and processes that help drive growth and revenue. The Partner Platform Operations Manager is expected to facilitate Paramount+ distribution efforts on emerging partner platforms, be involved with a varying range of projects, and will be expected to interact and handle relationships with cross-functional teams both externally and internally.

Title: Network Project Manager - II
Job_Description:
Hiring Salary Range: $135,000.00 - 150,000.00

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions. Overview & Responsibilities

We at Paramount Global are hiring a Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) for the End User Technology & Experience (EUT) Group within Technology! The EUT Team focuses on delivering engaging and intuitive experiences to boost efficiency, partnership, transformation, and engagement at enterprise scale, while making sure adoption and change management provide continued improvements. By leading the delivery of numerous projects, the TDM is ultimately responsible for acting as a Scrum Master for multiple work streams to make sure all the different processes across the Software Development Lifecycle are being followed. You will own and drive the process across a cross-functional team!
Responsibilities

Working with Product Owners and making sure a balanced backlog and sprints are being maintained. At the same time, assuring all user-stories and epics are aligned in JIRA, and are then groomed by the Product Owner and the Technical Architect on the project.
Make sure Product & Engineering are aware of blockers, bug status, and releases.
Performing sprint rituals with all the teams involved in delivery, globally. Unblock dev teams on a regular basis by including the right people. Plan for QA, UAT (User Acceptance Testing), and Prod releases by sharing game plans.
Planning & collaboration across different app teams to handle technical dependencies of the solution.
Present program and project level status updates for different partners, including Scrum reports. Present release notes as items move to production for team awareness.
Highlight and plan upskilling requirements for the project/program team while handling risks related to technical delivery.
Planning for maintenance and updating of multiple environments, like Dev, QA, Stage and Production.
Orchestrate onboarding of new teammates at various positions (e.g., Dev, Team Lead, QA, and architects).
Build high level strategy for the Engineering group based on the current capacity and different initiatives in flight.
Coordinate with other teams across the business and various technology owners of different platforms.
Collaborate with vendors to ensure their resources are meeting development and QA deliverables across multiple workstreams, platforms, and roadmaps.
Basic Qualifications

Minimum 5 - 7 years of experience as a Delivery Manager and possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a similar domain.
Proficient communicator; can generate reports and updates for various partners with different technical skill levels. Need to have a deep understanding of Agile methodology and Project Management skills.
Technical understanding of collaborative platforms (O365, SharePoint, Teams, Power Automate), web development, and SaaS (Software as a Service) platforms.
Efficiency with Project Management tools like JIRA, Excel, Office Project, Asana, and Lucid charts.
Additional Qualifications

Familiarity with ServiceNow and Web content management.
Exposure to website migration via different platforms and tenants of Office 365.

The Broker Analytics team within GRS Field Operations is seeking a Business Analyst to provide robust analysis and actionable insights in support of our GRS Broker Relationship Managers (BRMs). Our GRS BRMs are a group of senior leaders who manage the global relationships with Liberty's largest retail and wholesale broking houses.
We are seeking an energetic, driven analyst with creative problem-solving ability who will thrive in a fast-pace and complex data environment. In addition to direct analytic support of our GRS BRMs, the Business Analyst will be expected to support various aspects of our internal broker data pipeline processes (i.e. partnering with LSM and GRM to report on and analyze broker metrics, strategies, and opportunities with a global lens), and drive analyses in partnership with our external broker stakeholders in an effort to keep us ahead of our competition. The Business Analyst will be involved in regular ad-hoc analyses, along with the development of presentation materials and data packets in support of various internal and external executive meetings and engagements (i.e. conferences, roadshows, and relationship building events).
The ideal candidate must be a strong collaborator and be able to work with general direction from manager on more complex tasks.

Title: Customer Experience Analyst
Job_Description:
Security and Counterintelligence is responsible for the protection of NSA/CSS information, people and facilities worldwide. In support of this mission, Acquisition Security Analysts apply acquisition security principles and risk reduction methodologies. They collect data concerning sponsor needs and product application by reviewing acquisition documentation or tasking from sponsoring organizations and interviewing sponsors. They evaluate vendors and products to determine the extent of any foreign influence. They coordinate with subject matter experts to determine the level or risk associated with product use.
Acquisition Security Analyst responsibilities include, but are not limited to: - Applying principles, methods, and tools for assessing and mitigating threats/vulnerabilities - Understanding commercial information technology marketplace, products, and services - Assessing applicability of available tools to various situations - Understanding the principal methods and techniques of gathering intelligence information - Evaluating the scope and availability of intelligence analysis tools available at NSA - Preparing and maintaining case files, risk assessments, and acquisition security databases detailing the findings, recommendations, status, and results of assessment actions. - Reviewing acquisition strategy plans to identify acquisition security concerns associated with acquisition strategies and provide guidance for addressing those concerns. - Developing and monitoring implementation and effectiveness of countermeasures for mitigating security risks. - Briefing customers and managers concerning acquisition security policy and procedures and specific cases.

Monitor all incoming provider payment dispute channels including mail, fax and phone
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Title: Mid-Level Java Developer (with training)
Job_Description:
Ready to advance your career in technology?
If so, GenSpark could be an excellent opportunity for you! We have opportunities for developers with a few years of experience that are looking to take their career to the next level.
As a GenSparker, you don’t just get a job - you also get job-ready training. During your first 8 weeks with GenSpark, we provide paid training in technical and soft skills to take your skills to the next level. The right candidates for this program have a few years of IT experience, so we build upon your existing knowledge base to help you get to the next phase of your career. This role will train you to be a Mid-level Java Full Stack Developer, teaching skills including Java, Spring, Spring Boot, Web Development, Hibernate, MySQL, React, and AWS Fundamentals.
After completing GenSpark’s training, you will work with our clients to design and implement scalable software solutions, gaining hands-on experience with the technologies you just trained on. Responsibilities include working with client teams to develop innovative solutions and solving complex business problems with next-gen technologies. Most GenSpark clients are Fortune 500 employers seeking skilled & diverse talent, so you will gain experience working with one of the world's top employers. GenSpark's emphasis on training and hands-on experience provides the perfect platform to accelerate your career as a Software Engineer.

Title: Mid-Level Java Developer (with training)
Job_Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. The Team:
As an Integration Service Engineer Lead Consultant, you will be responsible for driving major initiatives for the team. Also serve as an escalation to more junior Engineers while they support installing, configuring, patching, upgrading, and maintaining the various components and technologies associated with any of the technologies like Tibco, Apigee, Kafka enterprise platform. This includes architecture, project planning and designing.


Final Allstate escalation point for Incident, Change and Problem Management Activities
Liaison to Vendors on technical issues or during new design creation
Creation, design, technical implementation and roll-out of major initiatives
Ensure communication and change management activities support a successful roll-out to end users of the Platform enterprise
Ensure conformance to established system architecture, methods, regulations, standards and practices
Analyze and solve high technical issues
Coach and mentor more junior Engineers
Work within a team environment while communicating well to a diverse set of colleagues
Develop operational processes to address enhancements to the capabilities and periodic maintenance disciplines
Improve documentation, templates and processes
Involvement with continuity management Disaster Recovery exercises to ensure that the team are fully prepared in the event of a catastrophe
Understanding relevance of known problems and resolutions. Make recommendations for improvement


Possess a minimum of 3 years’ experience supporting one of the following products (or equivalent)
TIBCO BusinessWorks
TIBCO EMS
Apache Kafka
Apigee
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills


(Experience in one of the following may be used if we have a high number of applicants)
Experience with tools such as DataDog, Jconsole, Splunk, ServiceNow, VersionOne, Ansible, Jenkins, and GitHub
Experience working in an Agile environment
History of developing automation and/or analytics for enterprise platforms
Desire to pass on knowledge to peers


Weekday and weekend shifts. On Call rotation will be a requirement of this role.

Compensation offered for this role is $80,500.00-$134,800.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. Title: Mid-Level Java Developer (with training)
Job_Description: Network Professionals are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office or one of the different development programs like the Applied Computing Development Program (ACDP). We are hiring entry to senior networking professionals with education and/or experience in several of the following areas: - Multi-vendor infrastructure platforms (i.e., Cisco, Brocade, Juniper, Arista) - Network encryption devices and WAN accelerators - Multi-vendor Layer 3 routing protocols (i.e., BGP, OSFP, EIGRP, IGRP, HSRP, VRRP) - Virtual Private Networking (i.e., MPLS, GRE, L2VPN, EVPN, Pseudowire, IPsec, MACSEC) - Data center architectures and converged networks - Current networking trends, including commercial implementations of Software Defined Networks (SDN) for both Data Center Network and WAN applications - Load balancing and Application Delivery Controller technologies and implementations - WAN architectures (i.e., Carrier Ethernet, Optical Fabrics (OTN), SONET) - Network monitoring tools (i.e., NetFlow Tracker, HP Network Node Manager, Cisco LMS, Cisco Call Manager, Wireshark, and Splunk) - Network Modeling (RiverBed/OPNet, NetSim) - Network Boundary (Next Generation Firewalls (Palo Alto, Cisco FIREPOWER), IPSEC/SSL VPN Concentrators) - Cross Domain Solutions (SafeNet MDeX System, OWL Cyber Defense Cross Domain Solutions) - Technical certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, SEC+). The ACDP is a three-year full-time development program. The goal of the program is to provide entry-level information technology specialists (that is, individuals with degrees in computer science, information systems, information technology, and related degrees and experience) the opportunity to learn the various facets of the mission. These facets include: - Development, engineering and deployment of NSA mission systems - Architecture, development, building, and maintenance of NSA's fault-tolerant world-wide information technology infrastructure - High-performance computing system development for cryptanalytic mission applications - Human resources, financial, and other business data warehouse storage and access - Information system security, engineering, testing, and evaluation.

This is a remote-based role within select states in the United States. At this time, we are only able to employ those located in the following states: Florida, Georgia, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, and Washington.
This position will require travel to our NY office headquarters for up to four times per year for internal meetings and team-building activities. The cost of travel for employees out of the area will be covered by the company. Additionally, our offices are always available for staff to use as much as desired.

Title: Mid-Level Java Developer (with training)
Job_Description:
Role Description This role sits within our infrastructure security team, working with our partners to build, obtain, and integrate security infrastructure that serve as secure-by-default guardrails to help keep Dropbox trustworthy for our customers.
We build tools and capabilities that keep Dropbox customers' data confidential and utilize all modern knowledge and architecture to protect their data.
We strive to build and design modern, frictionless security experiences and processes to adopt a trust but verify mindset.
Our Dropbox Infrastructure Engineering team is passionate about building awesome products at massive scale.
We've developed a set of values that enable us to do this.
Specifically, we write phenomenal software and sweat the details, focus on impact, and create an enduring culture.
Building elegant products begins with lots of hacking and iteration to explore the problem space.
It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship reliable code that never compromises data integrity or security.
Every Dropbox software release improves millions of lives, and you'll find a high petabyte-to-engineer ratio here.
We're bold when it comes to shipping high-leverage projects, even if they're risky or novel.
We care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration.
Trust and respect are deeply rooted in our engineering culture.
At the heart of Dropbox lies the largest networked filesystem in history.
We routinely tackle audacious challenges, often against competitors who have 10-50x our resources.
On top of this foundation, we're crafting products that enable people to do amazing things with their stuff across all their devices.
We hope you'll join us! Responsibilities You will build and develop large-scale infrastructure for security services and tools You will build infrastructure to handle metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connections You will scale Dropbox as the data fabric which connects hundreds of millions of the world's apps, devices, and services You will measure and optimize as Dropbox continues to build one of the industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive meaning from vast amounts of data Requirements BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics) or equivalent technical experience 5+ years of professional software development experience Extensive experience building and owning large-scale, multi-threaded, geographically distributed backend systems Highly skilled at developing and debugging in C/C++, Java, or Go Knowledge of Python a plus Experience with operating system internals, filesystems, databases, network, and compiler also a plus Familiarity with Linux Total Rewards Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families.
Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage (US Only) Competitive 401(k) Plan with a generous company match and immediate vesting Flexible Time Off/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, 11 Company-wide PTO days, Volunteer time off and more Protection Plans including; Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and Travel benefit plans Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family Additional benefits details are available upon request.
Dropbox is in the process of updating our technology to provide pay ranges in New York City based on the recent amendments to the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL).
If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

Our software is used by a wide range of companies to develop and deploy online surveys, and to view survey results using our online reporting and analysis tools.

Effectively isolate and fix related JavaScript/jQuery/html bugs via problem-solving skills and experience with Chrome DevTools.
Build and support form-based user engagement pages of an online survey software platform.

We have opportunities at our NSA Headquarters and at our NSA Hawaii regional center.
